messages.message: @Ted any suggestions on the OCR 8 problem? All 0s has a slash in between.. I feel we can’t do much here.. let me know your thoughts..
That is really tough without a targeted ocr model
If the importance of it is “use any tricks just to get things working”
Then there is a chance wading into the raw confidence values might reveal a meaningful difference
To post hoc flip certain 8s to 0s
Alternatively, if it’s critically important.. we could always train something up to distinguish.. but that would be odd to integrate and only targeted at this dataset
Is this an image pdf? It looks like text
Abbyy allows you to tag these and put them in a model
I don't know how to do it
and it will start biasing the result

@Ted @Anant Thanks! This is a request we got Vikram for the SC Hackathon.. Training a model specific to this dataset seems to be only solution but it's way out.. This is a PDF doc but there are scanned ones as well.. I will inform there is no quick fix to this... And this is one off doc they should be ok
Somebody tried to train tesseract for this and was not successful.. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53090447/tesseract-ocr-confuses-slashed-0-as-8
